Comment 3: 
It was me (and PeterGo) who introduced path.DirSeps. They contain _all_ valid directory
separators, i.e. forward and backslash because they are used in path.Split. 

In fact, I for one would recommend to use the forward slash as a path separator on
Windows. If you call path.Glob with a pattern containing backslashes, such as `c:\*.*`,
then the backslash is interpreted as an escape character, and \* will match a literal
asterisk, which is not what you want.
